data.title: I would recommend this restaurant
data.text: Went there for the first time. Pretty good, spacious, good screens and bar section. a dish can be shared between two and is filing. I could get Indian taste from the food. Service was quick.

data.title: The worst Indian restaurant ever
data.text: I wish I could give zero stars for food , ambience, and customer service. We were greeted with an odd smell on entry. One look at the items on the buffet and I decided to skip it. The soggy oily aloo bonda on the buffet made a terrible impression. My husband was brave enough to try the buffet and found the carrot halwa was stale. When I told the management about this there was not even an apology. The samosas we ordered from the menu were barely ok with too mush salty masala on top. I'm a true foodie when it comes to Indian food and this is truly the worst Indian good I've ever eaten thus far. And serving stale food is unpardonable on a buffet that cost 11.99.

data.title: Awesome food, heavy on stomach, light on pocket.
data.text: I am a pure vegan. I opted for vegetable biryani and mango lassi. Biryani was just like the one I had in paradise in Hyderabad. Very tasty, heavy on stomach and light on pocket (11 USD). I suggest that 2 persons can share 1 biryani. To top up, I had mango lassi. Mind you, this was way better than any lassi I had in south India ( of course u could find best lassies in north India). If u r a vegan, I suggest that u definitely visit this place. They have many veggie options.

data.title: "Not good"
data.text:
My wife and I had a meal here on 6 August.  We had the goat curry and aloo bengon, the aubergines were well cooked but consisted more potatoes then aubergines. Whilst the goat tasted good, it was under cooked " tough and chewy". We also ordered 2 pratha's, which looked like butter chapati's.
The restaurant could do with a  good fit out. Look more like a shanty town road side dhaba then a restaurant.

Sorry guy's, I have been in the Indian restaurant trade for the last 37 years and this did not impress. "Far from it"

data.title: Amazing dishes!
data.text: My wife and I went there last night and absolutely enjoyed the food. The waitress was very friendly. She provided good recommendations. The food was absolutely delicious. I ordered the lamb biryani, spicy! It was indeed spicy and full of mouth watering flavor. Most indian restaurants that I've been to don't like to make the food spicy even when asked. I guess they figure non-indians can't handle spicy foods? My wife ordered the chicken vindalu and loved it as well. There was an abundance of chicken in the vindelu. Most places give you a lot of sauce but very little meat. This place gave a lot of meat. The vegetable samosas were fully stuffed as well. Very delicious food.The portion sizes were great. If I lived in San Diego I would eat there all the time!

data.title: Lunch Buffet even on Saturday!
data.text: I have to say I'm thoroughly impressed. I was so happy to find an indian restaurant so close to my apartment that offers buffet lunch. I tried everything, and I liked it all. I went at 1 pm and although there weren't a ton of customers, the entire restaurant and buffet was stocked and spotless with all tables set. I couldn't be happier. I will return.

data.title: Great value
data.text: The restaurant is very understated, something like a transport cafe, but we had the lunch menu (was tempted by the buffet!), and the food was very good, and excellent value

data.title: Great prices and service, average food
data.text:
I love Indian food, and this place sells it, but it's not what I'd call "authentic" Indian food.  Quite frankly, I felt as though it catered a bit to American tastes (more mild, less flavors, less layers of flavor).  The prices were good, the restaurant was clean and spacious, and the service was top notch.  Our waitress and another gentleman was very attentive, especially since I had two small kids and it was late in the evening.  

The food was average, but everything else was better than expected.  We had the samosas (no flavor, color, or spice), briyani chicken (bland, but there was so much juicy dark meat in there and I loved that!), and the chicken tikka masala (which was really butter chicken).

data.title: indian food
data.text: the daily buffet is 10 dollars. very good food. friendly staff. perfect location by Horton plaza.  and a bar.

data.title: Average Indian food, delivered to my hotel
data.text: This Indian food, which was delivered to my hotel in an hour, was a little above average. I found the korma to be smooth and the chicken was well cooked. However the onion bhaji was not too dissimilar to "onion rings" and, perhaps as a result of being in a small styrofoam container, was soggy and unappealing, although it tasted fine. But I ordered for convenience and was satisfied enough with my food (via Yelp/Eat 24).

data.title: Best Indian restaurant in San Diego
data.text: After having tried many Indian restaurants in San Diego over the last few years, I can confidently say that this is the best Indian restaurant in San Diego. Very friendly staff, great food, wide menu choices, great beer and wines, and a central location make this a great restaurant.

data.title: strangely quiet
data.text: We were the only ones eating here early on a Saturday night, which was quite odd seeing the food was excellent. As a result, the atmosphere wasn't the best but certainly can't complain about the food.

data.title: Good buffet and good variety
data.text: This place was rated well on trip advisor so we took a chance. There was a good variety of food and it was quite tasty. Would go again if in that area!

data.title: Pleasant Buffet
data.text:
Indian buffet's are one of my favorite types of buffets. I always have a hard time deciding what I want to eat, so a little of everything is perfect. They had  large assortments and I feel all were good except
the beef masala - it was too tough and they should use lamb, which is more authentic.

data.title: Fantastic Value and Variety
data.text:
I was staying at the US Grant Hotel and wanted lunch. Directly across the street is Urban India, so I figured why not? It turned out to be a great choice.

The lunch buffet is a terrific deal. There was chicken curry, butter chicken, peas and mushrooms, chicken tandoori, two types of rice, salad, pakoras, black eyed peas and more.

There were even things on the buffet but I've never had before. There was a delicious beef dish and a brown sauce that was excellent. And a sweet carrot dish that was also very good and previously unknown to me.

The food was so good I went back for three helpings. Best of all the entire meal, with tip, was only $13. If you like Indian food and you're downtown in San Diego make sure to pay Urban India a visit at lunch.

data.title: Delicious Indian food, nice restaurant.
data.text: I really enjoyed the food here. Definitely satisfied my craving for Indian food. I like how they included basmati rice in the price of entrees. Therefore, I think the food was good value. I had the Tiki Masala and my boyfriend the traditional curry with lamb. My boyfriend thought mine was better than his but they were both delicious. We both ordered mild because we're used to how incredibly spicy Indian food is, but our meals were hardly spicy at all. I definitely could have gotten moderate or maybe even very spicy. We ordered a side of garlic naan bread which was delicious, but again you could hardly taste the garlic. Nonetheless, the food was delicious, good value and great service.

data.title: Good value
data.text: Lunch buffet was OK. The price and staff were both better than the food which was a bit on the bland side. However, it is a good place for a larger group (we had 6 people).

data.title: Fabulous Indian Food
data.text: We eat Indian food a lot at home in England so, having been on holiday in the US for three weeks, we were really missing it. The menu here was wide ranging with lots of vegetarian choices and the food itself was just what I had hoped for. The only down side to the food was my partner's "nan" which arrived as a small round flat bread, not a big puffy nan shaped nan. My rather mean three star rating is because there were not enough waiting staff; one guy seemed to be waiting the tables all on his own and when we arrived we waited so long at the bar for someone to turn up and serve us a drink that we considered walking out again.

data.title: Great Value Lunch Buffet...
data.text:
I can only vouch for the lunch and there were lots of options - vegetarian, chicken, lamb although strangely no fish. Being English we have lots of experience of eating curry and this was very similar to what we'd get back home in Bangladeshi run restaurants. 

It's absolutely not the quality I'd want or expect if I ate a la carte but for 10 dollars it was fine.

data.title: A good Indian buffet right near the Gaslamp
data.text:
We discovered this place by accident and now we've been there ~4 times. $10 lunch buffet 7 days a week 11-3, including Sat and Sun when most San Diego Indian restaurants do NOT have a buffet. This is a huge bargain compared to almost evertyhing in the Gaslamp. Big selection and it changes a lot - vegetables might include cauliflower, mushrooms, zucchini, sag paneer, etc. and meats have included both lamb and goat (I don't think I've ever had goat before in an Indian buffet) as well as several chicken dishes. The tandoori chicken is tasty, not too dry. I eat a lot of Indian food although I'm not Indian, and their seasoning is generally right on target for me - flavorful, but not too salty and not too hot.

Note: It's a very large dining room. On nice days, we like to eat at the tables closest to the street. They have big windows that open right up and it's like eating outside, right across the street from the US Grant.
